meanings.definition: A flexible board that can be bent by weight or pressure and is used for jumping or diving into water.
meanings.sent1: The springboard at the pool edge bounced as the diver leaped.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast gracefully launched off the springboard into the air.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the springboard for a seesaw.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a springboard propelling joy into the room.
meanings.sent5: The springboard creaked under the weight of the athlete, ready to catapult them into the pool.

meanings.definition: A starting point for an activity or process.
meanings.sent1: The successful completion of the course was a springboard for her career.
meanings.sent2: The internship served as a springboard for his future endeavors.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected snow day became a fun springboard for building snowmen.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music was a springboard launching him into the world of composing.
meanings.sent5: The new job offer acted as a springboard for her to explore new opportunities.
